page.title: 15Entertainment
page.content: The Gracie Fields' Theatre, situated within the Oulder Hill Community School campus, is approx. one mile from the town centre. It was named after Rochdale's first lady of song, who opened the theatre in 1978. Gracie was born on the 9th January 1898 and started life as a cotton winder before making her name on stage and films. This theatre seats 670 and offers a wide range of entertainment both at amateur and professional levels. Champness Hall is in the centre of Rochdale and was opened on the 8th September 1925. It is famous for its musical concerts and has a huge organ, which produces perfect notes in ideal acoustic surroundings.
